previous_headings: Morphological relationships of bullseye puffer Sphoeroides annulatus and their potential use in fishery management
title: Example-Analysis
text: Morefi package: Morphological Relationships Fitted Robust Regression. methodological package developed R analyze submitted article: Aguirre-Villaseñor, H., Morales-Bojórquez, E., Cisneros-Mata (FISH13711). Biometric relationships fisheries management tool: case study bullseye puffer (Sphoeroides annulatus. Tetraodontidae). Fisheries Research. objective study provide quantitative data morphological relationships predict: biomass different weight categories, fillet yield body measurements suitability fillet yield used management reference point bullseye puffer Sphoeroides annulatus. , two exercises proposed using 250 g fillet (benchmark) reference: () many organisms required obtain benchmark changing average length? (ii) taking account five maximum number organisms species allowed recreational fishing per person per day, average size reach benchmark?

text: Morefi package includes functions facilitate data analysis ensure reproducibility results.information functions, please visit Morefi GitHub page. install package GitHub following R console: Morefi installed, either updates necessary package installs already present. make sure necessary packages example date, defined packages vector. package already installed, loaded; , installed loaded.
code: if (!require("Morefi")){         library(devtools)         install_github("Macrurido/Morefi") library(Morefi)         } packages <- c("broom", "dplyr","ggplot2", "ggtext", "glue",               "investr", "kableExtra", "latex2exp", "Morefi",               "patchwork", "purrr", "reshape2", "robustbase")  for (i in packages) {   if (!require(i, character.only = TRUE)){     install.packages(i, dependencies = TRUE)     library(i, character.only = TRUE)   }  # End if } # End for

previous_headings: Morphological relationships of bullseye puffer Sphoeroides annulatus and their potential use in fishery management > Instaling Morefi
title: Example-Analysis
text: Morefi, data utilized Aguirre-Villaseñor et al. (Submitted) incorporated. file Botete biometric data bullseye puffer S. annulatus, following variables, three lengths (cm): total (LT), standard (LS) body trunk (LB); three weights (g): total (WT); body trunk (WB) fillet (Wfi). Additionally, categorical variable called ‘Fleet’ distinguishes artisanal (fresh) trawling (frozen-thawed), represented values 1 2, respectively. access data file, data frame stored mydata. second dataset, Botete_land, contains records pufferfish catches landed along Mexican Pacific coast 2023, measured kilograms (kg). includes information landed weight categorized landed, well conversion live weight, referred biomass, landing presentation. dataset outlines total weight (WT), body trunk weight (WB), fillet weight (Wfi). Additionally, specifies whether catch fresh frozen-thawed. dataset also includes value landed catch Mexican pesos (Pesos $) value per kilogram landed weight (Pesos_kg) (SIPESCA, 2024). access data file, data frame stored catch.

previous_headings: Morphological relationships of bullseye puffer Sphoeroides annulatus and their potential use in fishery management > Metodology
title: Example-Analysis
text: Eight relationships fitted, six simple linear model: LT vs LS, LT vs LB, LS vs LB, WT vs WB, WT vs Wfi, WB vs Wfi; three potential model: LT vs WT, LT vs WB, LT vs Wfi. perform regression, list named modelos created specify variables included. variables stored vector.
code: modelos <- list (LTvs.LS  =  c(1,2),                  LTvs.LB  =  c(1,3),                  LSvs.LB  =  c(2,3),                  WTvs.WB  =  c(4,5),                  WTvs.Wfi =  c(4,6),                  WBvs.Wfi =  c(5,6),                  LTvs.WT  =  c(1,4),                  LTvs.WB  =  c(1,5),                  LTvs.Wfi =  c(1,6))

title: Example-Analysis
text: Empty tables lists fill, throughout cycles. organize present results regression analysis, several tables created based List_base. store results model every data source, nested lists developed. structure allows hierarchical multi-level organization data. first level, datasets categorized three groups: Fresh, Frozen-thawed (Frozen), Total sample (Total). second level, sub-lists provide results various fitted models model_list. number items list names depend fitted model x y. Using List_base
code: # Create empty model list   model_list <- setNames(lapply(names(modelos), function(x) NULL), names(modelos))  List_base <- list("Fresh"= model_list,                   "Frozen"= model_list,                   "Total" = model_list)

previous_headings: Morphological relationships of bullseye puffer Sphoeroides annulatus and their potential use in fishery management > Metodology > Regression results.
title: Example-Analysis
text: store summary regression, customised table T1 generated. type function model (Linear Potential), variables, indicated first two columns. third column indicates data source used (Fresh, Fresh-Thawed, Total). row stored: Intercept, confidence interval (CI95%); Slope; (CI95%); adjusted robust coefficient determination R2,adj,w,degrees freedom DF. store results fitted model, list called List_Tables created. item list contains customized table T1, initially filled NA values.
code: # An empty table to save summary regression results      T1 <- data.frame(matrix(NA, nrow = 3, ncol = 9)) names(T1) <- c("Function", "Model","Categories",                "Intercept", "CI95%","Slope",                "CI95%", "R2","DF") T1 #>   Function Model Categories Intercept CI95% Slope CI95% R2 DF #> 1       NA    NA         NA        NA    NA    NA    NA NA NA #> 2       NA    NA         NA        NA    NA    NA    NA NA NA #> 3       NA    NA         NA        NA    NA    NA    NA NA NA # Create model list including empty T1 table T1_model_list <- setNames(lapply(1:length(modelos), function(x) T1),names(modelos))  #List_Tables <- list("Fresh"= T1_model_list, #                    "Frozen"= T1_model_list, #                    "Total" = T1_model_list) List_Tables <- T1_model_list

previous_headings: Morphological relationships of bullseye puffer Sphoeroides annulatus and their potential use in fishery management > Metodology > Regression results.
title: Example-Analysis
text: List_TCCT store values calculus Coincident Curves Test store results model regressions, empty matrix 4 rows 8 columns created. table CCT stores values calculus Coincident Curves Test weight categories: Fresh, Frozen, Total Joined (sum values Fresh, Frozen): residual sum squares RSS, degree freedom DF, Analysis Residual Sum Squares ARSS, F-table, p-value decision criteria α\alpha= 0.05 Criteria. store results fitted model, list called List_TCCT created. item list contains customized table CCT, initially filled NA values.
code: catego <- c("Fresh","Frozen","Total")  nrow <- length(catego)+1              CCT <- (matrix(NA,nrow=nrow,ncol=8)) CCT[,2] <-  c(catego,"Joined") colnames(CCT) <- c("Model","Data","RSS","DF","ARSS","F-table",                    "p-value","Criteria")  # Create model list including empty T1 table List_TCCT <- setNames(lapply(1:length(modelos), function(x) CCT),names(modelos))  CCT

title: Morefi
text: Morefi package: Morphological Relationships Fitted Robust Regression. methodological package developed R analyze submitted article: Aguirre-Villaseñor, H., Morales-Bojórquez, E., Cisneros-Mata (FISH13711). Biometric relationships fisheries management tool: case study bullseye puffer (Sphoeroides annulatus. Tetraodontidae). Fisheries Research. fisheries monitoring, body length commonly measured parameter quick easy obtain. contrast, measuring weight requires level stable scale, can difficult secure field sampling. Biometric relationships crucial fisheries biology. accurately calculated, relationships can useful management purposes, especially estimating organism’s total length weight based body measurements. Many species marketed artisanal fishing various commercial forms. However, currently biometric relationships allow predicting live weight (total weight fish) different categories landed weight, fillet weight, gutted weight, frozen weight. objective package provide quantitative models various morphological relationships help predict: ) expected live weight different landed weight categories, b) expected fillet yield various commercial presentations, c) testing suitability fillet yield reference point managing target species. purpose, functions vignette created explain process step step. implementation streamlines methodology enhances clarity impact results graphical presentations (tables figures personalized). functions included Morefi package enable evaluation length-length, weight-weight length-weight biometric relationships using data exhibit high variability meet assumptions necessary adjustment via least squares. Given variability, robust regression method employed analysis. “robustbase” package (version 0.99-2) utilized fit robust regression models, using functions lmrob() linear nlrob() non-linear regression (Maechler et al., 2024).

title: Morefi
text: can install development version Morefi GitHub using one following options: Using pak package using devtools package
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("Macrurido/Morefi") library(devtools) install_github("Macrurido/Morefi")

previous_headings: Data available in the package
title: Morefi
text: demonstrate package functions, utilize dataset botete, containing 1,397 fish across 7 variables: total length(LT), standard length (SL), body trunk length (LB), total weight (WT), body trunk weight (WB), fillet weight (Wfi) bullseye puffer (Sphoeroides annulatus), collected Eastern Central Pacific. dataset, landing category included “Fleet” variable, categorized follows: 1 indicates Fresh, 2 denotes Frozen-thawed. access data file, data frame stored object, ‘mydata’.
code: mydata <- Morefi::Botete

previous_headings: Data available in the package
title: Morefi
text: second dataset Botete_land, provided Mexican fishing records bullseye puffer landed Pacific coast 2023 live weight corresponding live weight weight category (kg): total (WT), body trunk (WB) fillet (Wfi), either Fresh Frozen-thawed (SIPESCA, 2024). access data file, data frame stored catch.
code: catch <- Morefi::Botete_land

title: Morefi
text: Morefi package includes functions facilitate data analysis ensure reproducibility results.

previous_headings: Morefi functions
title: Morefi
text: function fn_ARSS perform Coincident Curves Test, determine significant differences fitted curves database. based Analysis Residual Sum Squares (ARSS) (Chen et al. 1992). F=RSSp−RSSs3•(K−1)RSSsN−3•KF=\frac{\frac{RSS_{p}-RSS_{s}}{3\bullet \left( K-1 \right)}}{\frac{RSS_{s}}{N-3\bullet K}} RSSp=RSSRSS_{p}= RSS regression fitted pooled data, RSSsRSS_{s}= sum RSSRSS regression fitted individual sample, NN= total sample size, KK = number samples comparison. residual sum squares RSSRSS degrees freedom DFDF fitted regression previously stored List_TCCT list. regression, calculations stored data frame T1, stored iteratively using loop list T. Inside function, RSS DF joined sample calculated perform F test two tails α/2\alpha/2. decision criteria performed: “*” p−value≤αp-value\le \alpha “NS” p−val>αp-val\gt \alpha. function requires defining: List_TCCT: list fitted regression results. : integer value indicating ith regression analyzed. alfa: numerical value defines significance level. default number 0.05.

previous_headings: Morefi functions > fn_ARSS
title: Morefi
text: Total length (LT) - Total weight (WT) estimated bullseye puffer Sphoeroides annulatus landed categories: Fresh, Frozen-thawed (Frozen), Total (sample) Joined (sum values Fresh Frozen). Residual Sum Squares (RSS) degrees freedom (DF) provided data source. table first row displays Analysis Residual Sum Squares (ARSS), p-value (p), decision criteria ARSS test (Criteria). adjusted models show following data: Fresh SSR= DF= 742; Frozen SSR= 1280131.81 DF= 651; total sample SSR= 6115874.53 DF= 1395. Values stored table Table_CC, stored list, name item built acronyms model variables (e.g. LTWT). Table Coincident Curve Test.
code: Table_CC <- data.frame(matrix(NA,nrow=4,ncol=8)) Table_CC[1,1] <- "Lt-WT"  Table_CC[,2] <- c("Fresh","Frozen","Total","Joined") colnames(Table_CC) <- c("Model","Category","RSS","DF","ARSS","F-table","p-value","Criteria")  Table_CC[1,3] <- 4424418.33 Table_CC[1,4] <-  742  Table_CC[2,3] <- 1280131.81 Table_CC[2,4] <-  651  Table_CC[3,3] <- 6115874.53 Table_CC[3,4] <-  1395   List_ARSS <- list(LTWT=Table_CC)  i <- 1  ARSS <- fn_ARSS(List_ARSS, i,  alfa= 0.05)

previous_headings: Morefi functions
title: Morefi
text: function uses augment() function broom package extract observed values independent variable (x) dependent variable (y), along weights (wi), fitted values (fitt), residuals (ei) summary fitted model. turns components tidy tibbles. function augment() provide weights column lmrob() function. function fn_dfa() contains conditional statement includes variable output data frame linear adjustments. order homogenizes results, columns names renamed “y”, “wi”,“x”,“fitt”,“ei”. additional column included codes errors using scale based weighted values: unweighted (u), weighted (w), outliers (o) dfa$scale <- ifelse(df$wi < 0.25, "o", ifelse(df$wi<1, "w", "u")). function requires defining: eq: Summary equation fitted.

previous_headings: Morefi functions > fn_dfa
title: Morefi
text: bullseye puffer Sphoeroides annulatus, length-weight relationship modeled using robustbase::nlm function, ordinate input value = 0.1 slope b = 3. data frame mydata sourced Morefi::botete package. initial six rows table displayed. fn_dfa: fn_fig_cs: function creates individual plot displaying fitted model alongside observed values, colored according weighted color scale. fn_fig_e: function creates graph displays residuals vertical axis either independent variable predicted values horizontal axis, determined researcher. residuals color-coded using weighted scale. fn_fig_fw: fitted values models landed presentation category displayed multi-panel plot. observed data points fitted relationship categorized according weighted color scale. fn_fig_w: residual structure analyzed graphing residuals weighted values. custom multi-panel plot illustrates structure fitted relationship, categorized color-weighted scale values. fn_figs: Creates customized scatter plot observed values (points), fitted regression (solid line), confidence interval (shaded area). fn_freq: function calculates frequency distribution data. fn_freqw methodological function calculate percentage frequencies weights model adjusted using robust regression approach. fn_fyield: Calculates fillet yield dividing defined weight reference point bm mean, lower, upper confidence interval 95% (IC95%) estimated fillet weight, respectively. fn_intervals: Calculates non-parametric confidence predicted intervals using function predFit() package investr (version 1.4.2). fn_R2RV: Calculates robust version coefficient determination RRV2R^{2}_{RV} (Renaud & Victoria-Feser, 2010). fn_summary: Customizes stores summary fitted regression. fn_Wlive: live weight, total weight organism, estimated based weights different landing categories, eviscerated weight fillet weight. estimates derived using regression parameters relate total weight weight landing category. fn_xseq: Generates data frame sequence independent variables (including minimum maximum values) selects according model.
code: df <- mydata[,c(1,4)] colnames(df) <- c("x1", "y1")  a=0.01 b=3  eq <- robustbase::nlrob(y1 ~ a*x1^b, data= df,                         start = list(a= a, b= b),                         trace = FALSE)  dfa <- fn_dfa(eq)

text: Aguirre-Villaseñor, H., Morales-Bojórquez, E., Cisneros-Mata (FISH13711).Biometric relationships fisheries management tool: case study bullseye puffer (Sphoeroides annulatus. Tetraodontidae). Fisheries Research.

what: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land
title: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land
text: data set provides records bullseye puffer catch landed Pacific coast Mexico 2023. includes information Biomass (live weight) commercial landed presentation : total weight (WT), body trunk weight (WB), fillet weight (Wfi). data also indicates whether catch Fresh Frozen-thawed. Values provided Mexican pesos per landed category per kilogram landed weight (SIPESCA, 2024).

title: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land
code: Botete_land

title: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land
text: ## `Botete_land` data frame 5 obs.  5 variables: Category Landed presentation. Landed Landed weigth category (g). Biomass Converted landed category weigth total weight (g). Pesos Value Mexican pesos per landed category. Pesos_kg Mean value per kilogram landed weight.

title: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land
text: <https://github.com/Macrurido/Morefi.git>

title: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land
text: Category includes five commercial landed presentations: whole fresh (WT_Fresh);  body trunk fresh (WB_Fresh), body trunk Fresh-Thawed (WB_Fresh_Thawed); fillet fresh (Wfi_Fresh), sum total (Total).

title: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land

Fisheries Research. SIPESCA. 2024. Sistema de Información de Pesca y Acuacultura – SIPESCA. Comisión Nacional de Pesca y Acuacultura. <https://sipesca.conapesca.gob.mx>  (accessed 7 February 2024).

title: fn_ARSS — fn_ARSS
text: function fn_ARSS perform Coincident Curves Test, determine significant differences fitted curves database.based Analysis Residual Sum Squares (ARSS) (Chen et al. 1992).

title: fn_ARSS — fn_ARSS
code: fn_ARSS(List_TCCT, i, alfa = 0.05)

title: fn_ARSS — fn_ARSS
text: List_TCCT empty list save matrix results regression. integer value indicating ith regression analyzed. alfa numerical value defines significance level. set, default number 0.05.

title: fn_ARSS — fn_ARSS
text: List_TCCT calculations ARSS stored

title: fn_ARSS — fn_ARSS
text: residual sum squares (RSS) degrees freedom (DF) fitted regression stored previously List_TCCT list. Calculations ARSS also stored . Inside function, RSS DF joined sample calculated perform F test two tails alpha/2. decision criteria performed: "*" p-value less equal alpha "NS" p-value greater alpha. function requires defining.

title: fn_ARSS — fn_ARSS
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # The Total length (LT) - Total weight (WT) was estimated for the bullseye puffer # *Sphoeroides annulatus* for landed categories: Fresh, Frozen-thawed (Frozen), Total # (All sample) and Joined (sum of values of Fresh and Frozen). The Residual Sum of # Squares (RSS) and the degrees of freedom (DF) are provided for each data source. # In the table the first row displays the Analysis of Residual Sum of Squares (ARSS), # the p-value (p), and the decision criteria for the ARSS test (Criteria).  # The adjusted models show the following data: Fresh SSR=   and DF= 742; Frozen # SSR= 1280131.81 and DF= 651; and the total sample SSR= 6115874.53 and DF= 1395. # Values are stored in the table `Table_CC`, this is stored in a list, and the name # of each item is built with the acronyms of the model variables (e.g. LTWT).  Table_CC <- data.frame(matrix(NA,nrow=4,ncol=8)) Table_CC[1,1] <- "Lt-WT" Table_CC[,2] <- c("Fresh","Frozen","Total","Joined") colnames(Table_CC) <- c("Model","Category","RSS","DF","ARSS","F-table","p-value","Criteria")  Table_CC[1,3] <- 4424418.33 Table_CC[1,4] <-  742 Table_CC[2,3] <- 1280131.81 Table_CC[2,4] <-  651 Table_CC[3,3] <- 6115874.53 Table_CC[3,4] <-  1395  List_ARSS <- list(LTWT=Table_CC)  i <- 1  ARSS <- fn_ARSS(List_ARSS, i,  alfa= 0.05) ARSS[[i]] } # }

title: fn_R2RV — fn_R2RV
text: consistency corrected robust coefficient determination Renaud Victoria-Feser (2010) allows possible correction factor consistency considerations. Inside function: vectors observed (y1), predicted (yc) weighted (W) values obtained summary model (eq). value Weighted Estimate Average (ywea), modified sum squares explained (SSEw), total (SSTw), residual (SSRw) estimated. correction factor value consistency considerations 95 percent also obtained summary model (eq). vector robust version coefficient determination R2wa adjusted value R2wa_adj returned vector.

title: fn_R2RV — fn_R2RV
text: Renaud, O., & Victoria-Feser, M. P. (2010). robust coefficient  determination regression. Journal Statistical Planning  Inference, 140(7), 1852-1862. doi:10.1016/j.jspi.2010.01.008.

title: fn_dfa — fn_dfa
text: `fn_dfa()` function uses `augment()` function `broom` package extract observed values independent variable (x) dependent variable (y), along weights (wi), fitted values (fitt), residuals (ei) summary fitted model. turns components tidy tibbles.

title: fn_dfa — fn_dfa
code: fn_dfa(eq)

title: fn_dfa — fn_dfa
text: eq Summary equation fitted.

title: fn_dfa — fn_dfa
text: tibble data frame provides original data along information model.

title: fn_dfa — fn_dfa
text: function `augment()` provide weights column `lmrob()` function. function `fn_dfa()` contains conditional statement includes variable output data frame linear adjustments. order homogenizes results, columns names renamed "y", "wi","x","fitt","ei". additional column included codes errors using scale based weighted values: unweighted (u), weighted (w), outliers (o) `dfa$scale <- ifelse(df$wi < 0.25, "o", ifelse(df$wi<1, "w", "u"))`. information, please refer help documentation `broom::augment()`.

title: fn_dfa — fn_dfa
code: ## Example 1: robust linear regression  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- df eq <- robustbase::lmrob(y1 ~ x1, data= df,setting = "KS2014")  dfa <- fn_dfa(eq) } # }  ## Example 2: robust nonlinear regression if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- df a <- 0.01 b <- 3 eq <- nlrob(y1 ~ a*x1^b, data= datos, start = list(a= a, b= b), trace = FALSE)  dfa <- fn_dfa(eq) } # }

title: fn_freqw — fn_freqw

title: fn_freqw — fn_freqw
code: # In the df object, 30 random values between 0.1 and 0.9 are generated and # five values equal to 1 are added. # The breaks object is defined to include non-weighted values (wi=1), weighted # values (wi lower than 1 and equal to or higher than 0.25), and outliers # (wi lower than 0.25).  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- c(runif(n=30, min=0, max=1),rep(1,5)) breaks  <-  c(0, 0.249, 0.99, 1)  freq <- fn_freqw(df, breaks, right=FALSE) } # }
